column5: So had a morning to kill yesterday before going for treatment of my spider bite. My son, my buddy John and I hit Sparrow for 4 hours. Did most of our fishing at the mouth of the severn in the south end of the lake.Plenty of small pike caught on spinnerbaits and inline spinners. My buddy John switched over to a chugg bug and caught his new personal best largemouth out of 4 feet of water on a weed flat. Didnt get a weight but it was 21 inches long        Obligatory new world record poses      Have a nice day everyone
Dang near 15 pounds in that last shot!

WOW, nice fish! Thanks for the post, very timely as i am heading off with the wife this morning for a day of bassin and pike with spinners and topwaters......i had great success with my chug bug last year....but only one bass on it this year...you have renewed my faith in what has been a hot go to lure for me in the past for both pike and bass.   TY for sharing.
Wow, that thing is a hog!!  I think my oldman might try out Sparrow soon, never fished it before but we always enjoy trying new water.  Plus it being just up the road helps a bunch to!
Nice fish!!!    I caught a 21" bucket a couple of years ago and it weighed in at 5 pounds 12 ounces to give you a ballpark weight.  Congrats to John on his PB!
Very nice bucket! We were going to go to Sparrow twice and both times we chose another lake! Sparrow has a lot of pressure but there are some good fish in there of all species.Thanks for sharing.
nice fish..great feeling helping guide people into thier PB's for sure..
Great looking hog    Congrats to John for his PB  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Wow, excellent fish! Spider bite? Did I miss something? LOL!
You must have been on vacation  http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.p...=22815&st=0
